newsitem.title: USA: Computervision cuts sale terms of OSS unit.
newsitem.headline: Computervision cuts sale terms of OSS unit.

text.p: Computervision Corp said Friday it was cutting the cash price of its OSS business to $65 million because the unit's third and fourth quarter revenues and profits fell short by about $0.12 per share.
The Open Service Solutions business, which will be renamed CV Services International Inc, is being sold to an investment group headed by J F Lehman & Co.
Revised terms were $65 million in cash, $25 million in preferred stock of CV Services, and warrants to buy common shares representing 16 percent of the business, Computervision said.
The original terms were $100 million in cash, $25 million in preferred stock, and warrants to buy common shares representing 19 percent of CV Services.
Computervision said any gain from the sale would be "significantly offset" by shut-down costs associated with the sale.
